00020  public:

00030 // class Object
00031 
00032 /*
00033    @brief Object is the root class of all inertia classes
00034 
00035    It is responsible for runtime stuff
00036 */
00037 
00038 class Object {
00039  public:
00040  // Virtual destructor
00041     virtual ~Object() { }
00042  // Sets the name of the object
00043     void setName( string name ) { _name = name; }
00044  // Call the object's renderObject
00045     void render();
00046  // Render the object
00047     virtual void renderObject() { };
00048     Vector &pos() { return _position; }
00049     Vector &angle() { return _angle; }
00050     Vector &rotvel() { return _rotvel; }
00051     virtual void moveTo( float x, float y, float z ) {
00052       _position.x() = x;
00053       _position.y() = y;
00054       _position.z() = -z;
00055     }
00056 
00057  private:
00058   string        _name;
00059   Vector        _position;
00060   Vector        _velocity;
00061   Vector        _angle;
00062   Vector        _rotvel;
00063   list<Object*> _subobjs;
00064 };
00065 
00066 // class Actor
00067 
00068 class Actor : public Object {
00069  public:
00070   Actor() {
00071     _actors.push_back( *this );
00072   }
00073   virtual void advance() {
00074     angle().x() += rotvel().x();
00075     angle().y() += rotvel().y();
00076     angle().z() += rotvel().z();
00077   }
00078   static list< Ptr<Actor> >& actors() { return _actors; }
00079 
00080  private:
00081   static list< Ptr<Actor> > _actors;
00082 };
00083 
00085 //
00086 // class Camera
00087 //
00089 
00090 class Camera : public Object {
00091  public:
00092   virtual void moveTo( float x, float y, float z ) {
00093     pos().x() = -x;
00094     pos().y() = -y;
00095     pos().z() = z;
00096   }
00097 };
